page.title: 10THE STAPLETON ARMS
page.content: ON THURSDAY THE 26TH SEPTEMBER DAWN AND SHARON WENT TO THE STAPLETON ARMS PUB. WE ASKED MRS BROWN SOME QUESTIONS ABOUT THE PUB,SHE SAID "THE PUB WAS FIRST A CIDER HOUSE AND A PIG FARM." THE PRESENT BUILDING HAD BEEN STANDING FOR OVER 100 YEARS. THEN WE ASKED WHY IT WAS CALLED THE STAPLETON ARMS? MRS BROWN ANSWERED THAT THE PUB HAD BEEN CALLED THE STAPLETON ARMS BECAUSE IT HAD BELONGED TO THE STAPLETON FAMILY. THE PUB IS A FREE HOUSE AND SO IT SELLS ABOUT 290 BARRELS OF BEER A YEAR. A BARREL HOLDS ABOUT 36 GALLONS OF BEER. THE PUB BEST SELLING DRINKS ARE WHISKY AND DRAUGHT BEER. THERE IS KNOWN TO HAVE BEEN AN INN ON THE SITE BEFORE THE PUBLIC HOUSE. THE OWNERS HAVE 3 CHILDREN ALL MARRIED.THE PUB PLAY DARTS AND POOL. THE PUB ALSO SELL MEALS AND HAVE ABOUT 9 STAFF.
